title: Proth prime
summary: A Proth number is a natural number N of the form N = k × 2 n + 1 {\displaystyle N=k\times 2^{n}+1} where k and n are positive integers, k is odd and 2 n > k {\displaystyle 2^{n}>k} . A Proth prime is a Proth number that is prime. They are named after the French mathematician François Proth.[2]  The first few Proth primes are
